wikipedia_page.main: Guy Granet (21 September 1887 – 20 November 1953) was a British sports shooter. He competed in the 50 m pistol event at the 1948 Summer Olympics.

response: Sir William Guy Granet, GBE (13 October 1867 – 11 October 1943) trained as a barrister but became a noted railway administrator, first as general manager of the Midland Railway then as a director-general in the War Office.

Guy Granet was the second son of William Augustus Granet and his wife Adelaide Julia Granet, née Le Mesurier.Harold Hartley, ‘Granet, Sir (William) Guy (1867–1943)’, rev. Mark Pottle, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 3 April 2016 He was born in Genoa, where his father was a banker. His older brother was British army officer Edward John Granet.  He was educated at Rugby School and Balliol College, Oxford (Modern History, 1889) and was called to the bar in 1893 at Lincoln's Inn.
* 'Sir Guy Granet' [obituary] The Times, 12 October 1943, p. 6e
